intro: Phacelia pusilla, commonly known as dwarf phacelia, is a small flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features hairy, blue-green leaves and produces clusters of small, pale blue to purple flowers. It is often found in open areas such as meadows and disturbed soils. Phacelia pusilla is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
